main_definition: Channels refer to the various ways or mediums through which something, typically a substance or energy, can flow, transmit, or be directed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Sources of water flowing in natural paths
meanings_and_examples.example: The Colorado River is one of the major channels of freshwater in North America.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Ways for money to be transferred or invested
meanings_and_examples.example: She found a good channel through which she could invest her savings and earn interest.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Avenues for communication or broadcasting content
meanings_and_examples.example: The media company launched the new show on multiple channels to reach different audiences.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Pathways used by electrical currents in electronics and electrical engineering
meanings_and_examples.example: Resistors can be used to control the current flowing through various channels within a circuit.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Strategic approaches for achieving goals or managing resources
meanings_and_examples.example: He is looking for new channels of marketing that will help him grow his business.
